verse: [Therefore,] ·Does your life in Christ give you strength? [If there is any encouragement in Christ…] ·Does his love comfort you? […if any comfort from (his) love…] ·Do we share together in the Spirit? […if any fellowship/sharing of the Spirit…] ·Do you have mercy and kindness? […if any mercy/affection and kindness/compassion…]

·If so […then], ·make me very happy [fulfill/complete my joy] by ·having the same thoughts [being like-minded/of one mind], sharing the same love, and having one ·mind [heart; soul] and ·purpose [goal; mind].
When you do things, do not let ·selfishness [rivalry; selfish ambition] or pride be your guide. Instead, be humble and give more ·honor [regard; value] to others than to yourselves.
Do not ·be interested only in your own life [look out for your own interests], but ·be interested in the lives of others [look out for others’ interests].
In your lives you must ·think and act like [have the same attitude as] Christ Jesus. [What follows may be from an early Christian hymn.]

header: Be the People God Wants You to Be

verse: My ·dear friends [beloved], you have always obeyed God when I was with you. It is even more important that you obey now while I am away from you. ·Keep on working to complete [Continue working out] your salvation with ·fear [awe; reverence] and trembling,
because God is working in you ·to help you want to do and be able to do [both to will/desire and to work] what pleases him.
Do everything without ·complaining [grumbling] or arguing.

Then you will be ·innocent [blameless] and ·without any wrong [innocent; pure; harmless], God’s children without ·fault [blemish; as are sacrificial animals]. ·But you are living with people that are crooked and evil […in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation; Deut. 32:5], among whom you shine like stars in the ·dark world [or sky; world].

You ·offer [or hold firmly/fast to] the ·teaching that gives life [message/word of life]. So ·when Christ comes again [on the day of Christ; judgment day], I can ·be happy [be proud; boast] because I ·ran the race and won [did not run for nothing/in vain]. ·My work was not wasted […nor did I labor for nothing/in vain].

Your faith makes you offer your lives as a sacrifice in serving God. [Even] If I ·have to offer my own blood [am poured out as a drink offering] with your sacrifice, I will be ·happy [rejoicing] and full of joy with all of you.
You also should be ·happy [rejoicing] and full of joy with me.
I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon. […so that] I will be ·happy [encouraged] to learn how you are.
I have no one else like Timothy [1:1], who ·truly [genuinely] cares for you.
Other people ·are interested only in their own lives [pursue their own interests/concerns], not ·in the work [the interests/concerns; the things] of Jesus Christ.
You know ·the kind of person Timothy is [his tested and proven character]. You know he has served with me in ·telling the Good News [the Gospel], as a son serves his father.
[Therefore] I ·plan [hope] to send him to you quickly when I know what will happen to me [probably referring to the outcome of Paul’s trial in Rome].
I am ·sure [confident] ·that the Lord will help me to [in the Lord that I will] come to you soon.

[But; or Meanwhile,] I thought ·I should [it necessary to] send back to you Epaphroditus [4:18], my ·brother in Christ [brother] and coworker, ·who serves with me in Christ’s army [and fellow soldier]. He was your messenger, sent as a ·servant [minister] to meet my needs.
I am sending him because he ·wants very much to see [greatly misses; longs for] all of you. He is ·worried [distressed] because you heard that he was sick.
Yes, he was sick, and nearly died, but God had mercy on him and me too so that I would not have ·more sadness [sorrow upon sorrow].
I ·want very much [am very eager] to send him to you so that when you see him you can ·be happy [rejoice], and I can stop worrying about you.
Welcome him in the Lord with much joy. Give honor to people like him,
because he almost died for the work of Christ. He risked his life to give me the help you could not give in your service to me.
